intro: Stenospermation flavum, commonly known as the yellow stenospermation, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
